com.soa.wsf
Interface Call

public interface Call

Represents one call in the WS Framework.

Method Summary
 javax.activation.DataHandler getInAttachment(java.lang.String name)
          Returns an attachment with the given name included in this invocation.
 java.util.Set getInAttachmentNames()
          Returns the names of all attachments included in this invocation.
 java.util.Map getInHeaders()
          Returns the protocol headers included in this invocation.
 java.lang.Object getInProperty(java.lang.String name)
          Returns a property with the given name of this invocation.
 java.util.Set getInPropertyNames()
          Returns the names of all properties of this invocation.
 javax.xml.namespace.QName getInterfaceName()
          Returns the qualified name of the interface (as described in WSDL) used of the service being invoked.
 javax.xml.namespace.QName getOperationName()
          Returns the qualified name of the operation (as described in WSDL) being invoked.
 java.util.Map getSecuritySubjects()
          Returns a map of security subjects keyed by subject category.
 javax.xml.namespace.QName getServiceName()
          Returns the qualified name of the service (as described in WSDL) being invoked.

          Sets attachments that will be sent with the response to this invocation.

          Sets protocol headers that will be sent with the response to this invocation.

          Sets properties that will be associated with the response to this invocation.

javax.xml.namespace.QName getServiceName()
Returns the qualified name of the service (as described in WSDL) being invoked.

Returns:
QName of the service being invoked.

javax.xml.namespace.QName getInterfaceName()
Returns the qualified name of the interface (as described in WSDL) used of the service being invoked.

Returns:
QName of the interface being used.

getOperationName

javax.xml.namespace.QName getOperationName()
Returns the qualified name of the operation (as described in WSDL) being invoked.

Returns:
QName of the operation being invoked.

setOutHeaders

void setOutHeaders(java.util.Map headers)
Sets protocol headers that will be sent with the response to this invocation.

Parameters:
headers - Map of protocol headers. The key is a String. The value is a DocumentFragment.

getInHeaders

java.util.Map getInHeaders()
Returns the protocol headers included in this invocation.

Returns:
Map of protocol headers. The key is a String. The value is a DocumentFragment. May return null if no headers included.

getInPropertyNames

java.util.Set getInPropertyNames()
Returns the names of all properties of this invocation.

Returns:
Set of String property names.

getInProperty

java.lang.Object getInProperty(java.lang.String name)
Returns a property with the given name of this invocation.

Parameters:
name - String name of the property.
Returns:
Object property.

setOutProperties

void setOutProperties(java.util.Map properties)
Sets properties that will be associated with the response to this invocation.

Parameters:
properties - Map of properties. The key is a String. The value is an Object.

setOutAttachments

void setOutAttachments(java.util.Map attachments)
Sets attachments that will be sent with the response to this invocation.

Parameters:
attachments - Map of attachments. The key is a String. The value is a DataHandler.

getInAttachmentNames

java.util.Set getInAttachmentNames()
Returns the names of all attachments included in this invocation.

Returns:
Set of String attachment names.

getInAttachment

javax.activation.DataHandler getInAttachment(java.lang.String name)
Returns an attachment with the given name included in this invocation.

Parameters:
name - String name of the attachment.
Returns:
DataHandler holding the attachment.

getSecuritySubjects

java.util.Map getSecuritySubjects()
Returns a map of security subjects keyed by subject category.

Returns:
Map of security subjects. The key is a String indicating the category of the subject. The value is a javax.security.auth.Subject.
